definition: to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
to scald/to burn (by scalding)/to blanch (cooking)/to heat (sth) up in hot water/to perm/to iron/scalding hot

sentences.english: The saucepan may be full of hot water .
sentences.chinese: 烧锅里可能装满滚烫的热水。

sentences.english: The old man took up the doughy mass and placed it upon the hot stone.
sentences.chinese: 老人拿起那黏稠的团块，把它放在滚烫的石头上。

sentences.english: What if he ended up with a hot pan on his head?
sentences.chinese: 万一一口滚烫的锅扣在了他的头上怎么办呢？

sentences.english: The hot liquid splashed down on the concrete and rebounded.
sentences.chinese: 滚烫的液体泼在水泥地面上又溅了起来。

sentences.english: He has immerged the dress in the boiling dye for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 他已把衣服浸入滚烫的染料中两个小时了。

sentences.english: The paving stones burned in the noon sun.
sentences.chinese: 铺路石被中午的太阳晒得滚烫。

sentences.english: Another idea was that at the equator the ocean would be boiling hot.
sentences.chinese: 另一个想法是在赤道处，大西洋的海水是滚烫的。

sentences.english: I choose melt into the stove to change into the boiling hot molten steel.
sentences.chinese: 我选择熔入炉中化为滚烫的钢水。

sentences.english: It was like a red-hot blade gnawing at my eyelashes and gouging out my stringing eyes.
sentences.chinese: 滚烫的刀尖穿过我的睫毛，挖著我的痛苦的眼睛。

sentences.english: He held his hot face to the rain, and walked on in a trance .
sentences.chinese: 他恍恍惚惚昂着滚烫的脸颊，冒雨走着。

sentences.english: Don't picture the windowsill as a dull hot knife slitting open your belly.
sentences.chinese: 不要把窗沿想象成一把滚烫钝刀子在为你开膛破肚。

sentences.english: They come down for quality, hot food.
sentences.chinese: 他们下来后想要吃滚烫味美的食物。

sentences.english: Hot coals are then pushed to the side and a hole couple of inches deep is dug.
sentences.chinese: 然后把滚烫的煤推至一旁，挖下几英寸。

sentences.english: If you are cooking, oil or boiling water may spill during the quake.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在做饭，油或滚烫的水可能会因为震动溅出。

sentences.english: It shouldn't even be simmering, just the occasional bubble should pop up.
sentences.chinese: 使它甚至不应很滚烫，只是偶尔有小吱吱的煮热声。

definition: burning hot/fiery/to have one's hair permed with hot curling tongs
(of a liquid) to boil/(of sentiments etc) to boil over/to flare up/to be impassioned
to scald/to burn (by scalding)/to blanch (cooking)/to heat (sth) up in hot water/to perm/to iron/scalding hot
